alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 02 at 2:47PM PST until January 03 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon and southwest Washington, including the following areas, in northwest Oregon, Lower Columbia. In southwest Washington, I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County and Willapa Hills. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain with a front tonight, with rain at times Monday. Snow melt from the lower elevations will contribute to additional river rises. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
